title: 131 Lo, How a Rose Eâ€™er Blooming

lines: 1. Lo, how a rose e'er blooming From tender stem hath sprung, Of Jesse's lineage coming As men of old have sung. It came, a floweret bright, Amid the cold of winter When half spent was the night.
2. Isaiah 'twas foretold it The Rose I have in mind, With Mary we beheld it, The virgin mother kind. To show God's love aright She bore to them a Saviour, When half spent was the night.
